documents.document: @Mamaofabean We so did. Our friend talked his way into a private party at the TIFF Bell Lightbox venue & we partied hard. Good times.

@Mamaofabean And no, she wouldnâ€™t do it differently & I commend her for taking this stand. Her example serves to highlight the clear bias towards policing womenâ€™s behavior vs menâ€™s. https://t.co/rNcrDHtQ5B

@Mamaofabean This has less to do with policing her behavior and more to do with judging how the ump handled this call. Apply the exact same standard to male tennis players & I have no problem with the call. But this isnâ€™t the case at all.
@Mamaofabean I feel ZERO conflict here.

@Mamaofabean Fuck that. Plenty of male tennis players behave like this all the time & arenâ€™t penalized for it. Itâ€™s a clear double standard. Applied more harshly always for women (especially women of colour). Joe MacEnroe was a classic example of shit attitude. This didnâ€™t happen to him.
RT @BillieJeanKing: (2/2) When a woman is emotional, sheâ€™s â€œhystericalâ€ and sheâ€™s penalized for it. When a man does the same, heâ€™s â€œoutspokâ€¦
RT @RyanRosenblatt: Serena is 100% right. Male players are allowed to scream, curse, break rackets, yell at referees and they get away withâ€¦

RT @JRBlake: I will admit I have said worse and not gotten penalized. And Iâ€™ve also been given a â€œsoft warningâ€ by the ump where they tellâ€¦

@marissa_catena @IKEACanada Eww.
@CriRi_K A woman stands up for herself and is told to behave. Bros can just fuck right off into the sun. I am very comfortable with my inner â€œbad bitchâ€.

â€œMen, we need your voices. We need you to speak up when you see a double standard. We need you to say something when you hear a sexist comment. We need you to stand by us in outrage and demand change.â€ #HRtweets https://t.co/xkTyGpxMOv

John MacEnroe outburst: shakes fists & screams at ump. Two code violations. John literally challenges ump to â€œcall off the matchâ€, ump did not. If this were @serenawilliams she would have been arrested on the goddamn court. #MalePrivilegeInAction https://t.co/Kq0nbbiVhE

So John can regularly behave like a toddler - he just does it â€œfor funâ€. â¦@serenawilliamsâ© calls the ump â€œa thiefâ€ for arguably taking her point away unfairly, sheâ€™s called disrespectful & tossed from the game. #DoubleStandard #MalePrivilegeInAction https://t.co/aB66OAhGMt
@Mamaofabean Why donâ€™t you ask the umps whoâ€™ve been threatened by male players over the decades of menâ€™s tennis. Maybe youâ€™ll find you answer there.

@Mamaofabean I said itâ€™s â€œlikeâ€, I didnâ€™t say you said it. But frankly, the comparison holds. Blaming those who stand up for their rights / victim-shaming is a slippery slope. She owes nobody any do-overs to appease their privileged sensitivities.

@Mamaofabean Sure the situation was overall hard for everyone. But I will *always* prioritize a personâ€™s human rights over someone elseâ€™s hurt feelings. Otherwise, human rights just donâ€™t work. Thatâ€™s my priority.
Because RACISM. Thatâ€™s why. https://t.co/5xGGYhfvm2

@Mamaofabean No, I canâ€™t accept that. Policing her behaviour is like suggesting women who wear short skirts had it coming when they get raped. The line for me is very clear when it comes to supporting human rights.
@Mamaofabean Well, frankly - lucky for you this wonâ€™t ever happen to your kids. So it will be much easier for them to â€œtake the high roadâ€.

@Mamaofabean Itâ€™s unfortunate the other tennis player got caught in the crossfire, but sheâ€™s not disrespecting anybody by standing up for having her human rights violated like that. She owes no apology.

@Mamaofabean She wasnâ€™t disrespecting her opponent. She was sticking up for herself. If the ump didnâ€™t want so much drama in the game, he should have checked his racist sexist views before the game began. She owes no apology for standing until for her basic human rights.

@Mamaofabean On the back of also being â€œdisciplinedâ€ at the French open for wearing a suit intended to prevent blood clots & all the microagressions sheâ€™s endured to date for being a woman/Black/etc, I donâ€™t blame her one bit for being absolutely done with it. Full empathy from me.
@Mamaofabean I did. And I still maintain what I said.
@Mamaofabean That was AFTER he treated her badly. So what. Sheâ€™s standing up for herself. Good for her.

@Mamaofabean This is also part of the problem. She didnâ€™t â€œthreatenâ€ anybody. She called the ump â€œa thiefâ€ for stealing a point. But people often perceive â€œemotional black womenâ€ as threatening (aka racism). No, sheâ€™s deeply invested in her game & upset at unfair calls. Same as male players.
@Mamaofabean Omg we need either get you more facts on what happened or take you to internalized misogyny brainwashing rehab stat. Snap it out, girl.
